text: toxic shame can really destroy your life
here's why toxic shame is different from
guilt while guilt may go away in a few
hours or days toxic shame can stick
around for a lifetime it comes from
being told over and over that you're not
good enough this leads to persistent
negative selft talk that perpetually
affects how you see
yourself toxic shame is like a shadow
that follows you around Whispering that
you're not good enough it's a sinking
feeling of
condemnation a trap that can overwhelm
you if you don't learn to rise above it
so how do we overcome it one guilt
versus toxic shame before we dive in
it's important to understand the
difference between guilt and toxic shame
according to psychologist Helen BL Lewis
guilt is a natural emotion that occurs
when you feel remorse for something
you've done like saying something
hurtful or making a mistake for example
forgetting a close friend's birthday
this type of Shame can actually be
constructive motivating you to be more
considerate toxic shame on the other
hand is damaging it's a deep
internalized feeling of condemnation
that goes beyond specific actions toxic
shame attacks who you are as a person in
this case you're no longer the person
who forgot a friend's birthday you're a
bad friend you're not good enough
this negative selft talk traps you in a
cycle of self-doubt and prevents you
from being your best self but the good
news is you can break free from this
cycle here's how discredit public
shaming Studies have shown that shame
comes from people who are insecure about
themselves so they weaponize your
vulnerability to make themselves seem
Superior don't let their words Define
you understand that their need to put
you down reveals their own insufficiency
instead of absorbing their harmful
comments and letting them shape how you
see yourself see the shaming for what it
really is a reflection of their
insecurities not your worth respond with
confidence refuse to internalize their
negativity and move forward with your
head held high this approach allows you
to reclaim your power and break free
from the grip of toxic
shame three learn to forgive
yourself reflect ing on past mistakes
can be a valuable learning experience
but when it turns into self-
condemnation it becomes toxic Dr KL
young once said shame is a soul eating
emotion and studies show that lingering
shame can lead to chronic stress and
even impact your physical
health if you find yourself caught up in
past mistakes remind yourself that
you're human and that making mistakes is
part of that
experience it could be a word spoken in
haste an action you regret or a
situation you mishandled remember that
forgiveness is a gift you can give to
yourself so don't punish yourself for
past mistakes forgive yourself
today four hold the right party
accountable have you ever accorded blame
to yourself over a situation even though
you were not at fault in the treatment
of complex trauma professionals like CTO
and Ford emphasize the importance of
correctly attributing blame as part of
the healing process it is understandable
that you don't want to label yourself as
a victim however in certain situations
particularly in emotional verbal or
sexual abuse you were a victim of
someone or a problem that was beyond
your power in your need for control you
resort to what you can subconsciously
control feeling ashamed so you
internalize toxic shame at this phase in
order to heal you must release these
negative emotions by pointing the
fingers away from yourself don't take on
blame that isn't
yours are you finding this video
insightful hit that like button and drop
a comment we'd love to hear your
thoughts on this five Challenge and
reframe your thoughts shame thrives on
negative beliefs and distorted thinking
patterns it convinces you that you're
not good enough but here's the truth
these thoughts are not facts they're
just thoughts and you have the power to
change them psychotherapists recommend
using the triangle method to reframe
your thoughts imagine a triangle with
each angle representing thoughts
feelings and behaviors the first
triangle shows the negative thoughts
feelings and behaviors they produce the
second triangle represents the new
positive thoughts you want to adopt
for example when shame hits ask yourself
are these beliefs true or are they
distorted then reframe your selft talk
replace negative statements like I'm
worthless with something Kinder and more
truthful like I made a mistake but I'm
still
valuable six replace negative coping
mechanisms with healthy ones as you work
on healing and letting go of toxic shame
there will be moments when you need to
express your feelings
find positive ways to cope with your
emotions journaling can help you process
what you're going through creative
Outlets like art can also be therapeutic
it gives you a way to express your
feelings that words might not fully
capture avoid harmful behaviors like
substance abuse or self harm it does
more harm than good instead focus on
healthy activities that support your
well-being boost your confidence keep
you disciplined and help you move
forward
seven be future-minded but stay
present if we let go of the past and
start being future-minded we'll realize
that much of the toxic baggage we carry
holds us back from becoming our best
selves a study on emotional regulation
found that more future oriented
individuals tend to engage in better
emotional regulation strategies these
individuals are more likely to reframe
negative emotions like shame and guilt
in a way that promotes personal growth
and resilience however while it's good
to think about the future don't forget
about the present because research has
shown that being too future-minded can
lead to anxiety and that can affect your
well-being so strike a balance between
looking ahead and appreciating the good
things in the present
moment shame can be incredibly painful
but it doesn't Define You by
understanding the root of Shame
silencing negative thoughts and self-
condemnation in practicing
self-compassion you can work towards
healing and growth remember you are
valuable and deserving of Love even if
Society won't give it to you you owe it
to yourself don't let yourself down
feeling overwhelmed by shame watch this
video to find out the nine things you
should never be ashamed of
